What is On Aging?

On Aging is the nation’s largest multidisciplinary conference on aging and the annual conference for members of the American Society on Aging. On Aging 2025 is an opportunity to connect, learn, and share your expertise with thousands of professionals working in aging and related fields. This year we are uniting on the topic of Ageism & Culture, with Keynote speakers and special events focused on combating ageism in our society.

On Aging 2025 will take place April 21–24, 2025 at the Hyatt Regency Orlando.

What is On Aging?

On Aging is the nation’s largest multidisciplinary conference on aging and the annual conference for members of the American Society on Aging. On Aging 2025 is an opportunity to connect, learn, and share your expertise with thousands of professionals working in aging and related fields. This year we are uniting on the topic of Ageism & Culture, with Keynote speakers and special events focused on combating ageism in our society.

On Aging 2025 will take place April 21–24, 2025 at the Hyatt Regency Orlando.

Ageism—stereotypes, prejudice, and discrimination directed toward others or oneself based upon age—has profound social, economic and health impacts. The focus of On Aging 2025 will be to address ageism and its deep-rooted, pervasive presence in our culture.

By bringing together experts, policymakers and advocates, On Aging 2025 will explore innovative solutions and policy recommendations that could make our society more age-inclusive. The conference also will emphasize the importance of culture change, promoting positive representations of aging and fostering intergenerational understanding.

Join us at On Aging 2025 to be part of this vital conversation and to help create a more inclusive future.

Call for Proposals

ASA is pleased to open the Call for Proposals for On Aging 2025, with a special emphasis on content that highlights our Ageism & Culture priority area. Presentation proposals will be accepted from June 18–Aug. 9, 2024.

Please visit our Call for Proposals page to learn more about conference tracks, deadlines and session formats offered.

Become a Peer Reviewer

We are looking for ASA members to serve as peer reviewers on presentation proposals for On Aging 2025! If you are interested, please click here to complete an application by Aug. 9. Becoming a peer reviewer is a membership benefit of ASA. Note that peer reviewers will review assigned proposals from Aug. 14–Sept. 4, 2024. This leadership role will take approximately 5 hours of your time.

You must be a member of ASA to attend On Aging 2025. Non-members may attend by purchasing a membership when registering. Your membership MUST be valid as of April 21, 2025, to attend.

Registration is not yet open for On Aging 2025.

About ASA

The American Society on Aging (ASA) convenes the nation’s largest multisector community of professionals working in aging. We are the go-to source for learning, networking, and embracing opportunity in our aging society through an equity-focused lens. Founded in 1954 as the Western Gerontological Society, over the past 70 years ASA has grown into a diverse community of more than 5,000 professionals working with and on behalf of older adults. Our annual conference, On Aging, brings together thousands of our members to learn, network, and exhibit their work.
